title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Tuesday, 16 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: police issue warning to drive carefully in frosty conditions after a 12-vehicle accident on the a140 in roughton .
the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn says many nurses who wanted to come from abroad have been unable to get visas .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: updates for norfolk live have finished for today - thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county .

documents.title: weather : dry with the risk of frost
text: a dry , cold and frosty night with temperatures falling to 0c 32 ( f ) .
a chilly start to the day , followed by bright or sunny spells .
cloud increasing later and temperatures reaching 5c ( 41f ) .
there 's more information for the weather where you live here .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: today 's big frost at raveningham
text: many thanks to jenny bemment for sending us this of the frosty countryside near raveningham this morning .
if you have any photographs that you 'd like us to use as the day 's `` big you can send them to us on email .

documents.title: headlines : hazardous conditions on norfolk 's roads care home delayed treatment
text: the headlines this afternoon :

documents.title: delaying treatment 'led to death of elderly man '
text: an inquest into the death of an elderly man at a care home has heard a delay in getting him treated may have contributed to his death .

retired detective richard bass , who was in his 90s and suffered from diabetes , died in hospital from complications probably caused by a delay in obtaining appropriate care at brundall care home , the coroner ruled .
the home has since been rated inadequate by government inspectors .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: a crisp winter afternoon
text: it 's been a beautiful afternoon in the county - our weather presenter dan holley shared this of his view on twitter .
beautiful crisp winter 's afternoon at the @ twitterid broad

documents.title: drivers warned to take extra care ahead of another frosty night
text: this morning 's freezing temperatures and thick fog led to hazardous driving conditions , with norfolk police called out to 19 incidents - including the biggest crash , which closed the a140 at roughton for several hours .
well , watch out , because another cold night is forecast - gritters will be out from 18:00 .
insp john chapman from norfolk 's road policing unit advises motorists to allow extra time for their journeys , and to ensure their windscreens and windows are de-iced .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: number crunching is not for canaries
text: the back page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: video : twelve-vehicle collision in roughton
text: the a140 at roughton was closed for several hours this morning following a series of collisions involving cars and lorries .
it was one of seven serious incidents on norfolk 's roads , caused by freezing temperatures and thick fog .

documents.title: linnets hunt play-off spot
text: king 's lynn town travel to stratford tonight knowing a win could put them into the southern premier play-off places .
the linnets will be boosted by news that highly-rated defender matty castellan has new signed a new deal which keeps him at the walks for at least a further 18 months .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: norfolk 's fleet of gritters will be out tonight
text: our gritters will be heading out across norfolk tonight from 6pm , with drivers being warned that icy patches are possible # norfolkwinter
@ twitterid spoke to a woman who was convinced as it was 1/2 term you stopped gritting to schools .
please educate these thickets !
@ twitterid okay , thanks for the heads up .
i 'll try to get some facts 'n ' figures up on twitter and facebook over the next couple of days .

documents.title: the front page of the norwich evening news
text: the front page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: headlines : a140 reopens after multi-vehicle crash row brews over planning parking charge rises
text: the headlines this afternoon :

documents.title: a140 reopens after multi-vehicle collision
text: the a140 at roughton has reopened following a multi-vehicle collision earlier this morning .
norfolk police says 12 vehicles were involved in a crash and a series of shunts .
one man was taken to hospital but his injuries are not believed to be serious .
it was one of seven serious incidents on the county 's roads this morning caused by freezing temperatures and thick fog .

documents.title: coastal traders unhappy at parking plans
text: traders in north norfolk have raised concerns about plans to raise charges for parking , and to put in meters in cromer , sheringham and hunstanton .
sheringham trader andy bullen says more than 35 % of the town 's population is over the age of 65 , and `` elderly people coming in cars want to park outside where they want to shop . ''

richard leeds , from the cromer chamber of trade , is concerned that norfolk 's parking partnership 's proposals mean motorists would move their cars out of the main centre and park on the side roads where residents live .

documents.title: new camping craze comes to norfolk
text: there 's been glamping , and now there 's champing giving campers the chance to sleep in a church .
champers will be able to sleep 'under the angels ' at the church of st michael and all angels in booton .
the church was the creation of eccentric clergyman reverend whitwell elwin .
inside , he filled his fairytale creation with angels modelled on his young female friends .

documents.title: roughton crashes : the latest from the scene
text: a man has been taken to hospital following a series of collisions involving a number of vehicles in roughton earlier this morning .

police said there were three separate crashes within 30 minutes at the same spot , involving eight cars and two lorries - but it could be as many as 12 vehicles involved.. at least three of the cars and one lorry went into a ditch .
those vehicles have now been recovered , apart from one car .
three people were treated at the scene for minor injuries .
the injuries of the man taken to hospital are not believed to be serious .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: the search is on for new lifeguards for norfolk 's beaches
text: the rnli is holding try-out sessions to recruit more lifeguards to patrol the county 's beaches .
budding lifeguards will need to be able to complete a 400m ( 437yds ) swim in less than seven minutes and 30 seconds .
ten people , including two children , were rescued on wells beach on the first day of the lifeguard season last year .

documents.title: criticism starts at home for city boss
text: the back page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: advice for visitors to the norfolk broads
text: very slippery around the inland waterways of the # norfolkbroads today with freezing temps - fog & ice .
please take care & wear # lifejacket

documents.title: visa problems for foreign nurses
text: the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn says many of the nurses who wanted to come from abroad have been unable to get visas .
around 170 nurses were expected to come to the hospital from india and the philippines , but only eight visas a month are being granted .
chief executive dorothy hosein says the hospital is more than 70 nurses short , but staff have helped by doing additional shifts , and agency staff have been brought in .

documents.title: just one gp for 900,000 people
text: the front page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: icy roads problems causing delays for bus passengers
text: sanders coaches have warned passengers of possible delays to services `` due to accidents in the ice '' and road closures at roughton and bodham .
x44 major delays via @ twitterid

documents.title: plans to charge for parking in seaside towns
text: plans to charge for parking in three coastal towns are back on the table .
the norfolk parking partnership says charges for on-street parking in cromer , sheringham and hunstanton would help pay for parking enforcement elsewhere .
the chair of the partnership , mick castle , says they need to raise more money and this is the best way to do it .

documents.title: a140 remains closed after 12-car collision
text: one person has been taken to hospital following a crash involving 12 vehicles on the a140 at roughton .
the road remains closed .
norfolk police officers were called to seven collisions in one hour this morning , as overnight temperatures led to hazardous driving conditions .
they 're advising motorists to take extra care on the roads .
travel has further information for you .

documents.title: travel : rail disruption at ipswich causing problems to norwich services
text: train operator greater anglia says an issue at ipswich , which is being repaired , is still affecting services to norwich .
you can check the latest train travel situation here .
# ipswich - network rail engineers are on site and working as quickly as possible on the repair on the track on platform 2 .
kb
@ twitterid @ twitterid the whole system is fundamentally broken , and no one cares that people ca n't get to work national disgrace !

documents.title: police issue winter driving advice after possible 12-car collision
text: norfolk police is urging motorists to take extra care on the roads , as falling overnight temperatures have led to potentially hazardous driving conditions .
officers have been called to a number of collisions around the county this morning , including one on the a140 at roughton , where 12 cars are believed to have crashed .
travel will keep you up to date with any incidents across the county .

text: disruption to bus services

text: 08:30 norwich to liverpool st will be cancelled .
this is due to emergency services dealing with an incident near the railway yesterday .

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: hello and thanks for joining us for tuesday 's norfolk live .
we 'll have the news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the county from now until 18:00 .
do n't forget to get in touch if there 's a story , or maybe a photograph , that you 'd like to share with us .
you can send us an email or a tweet , or get in touch on facebook .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
